description: Installation of a kitchen extraction system including external flue, changes to internal floor layout.
subdivision_of_building: Change of use to ground floor unit. Extraction unit for kitchen located on side elevation
application_type_full: Full planning & demolition in a conservation area
decision_conditions: The proposed extractor flue, by reason of its scale, bulk, design, visual prominence and inappropriate siting on the east/side elevation of the locally listed building, would harm the character and appearance of the host building and fail to harmonise with the historic local context. The development would result in less than substantial harm to the heritage asset and would fail to preserve and enhance the appearance and character of the Northwood Town Centre, Green Lane conservation area. The harm identified would not be outweighed by public benefits associated with the development. The development is therefore contrary to Policies BE1 and HE1 of the Hillingdon Local Plan: Part One - Strategic Policies (2012), Policies DMHB 1, DMHB 3, DMHB 4 and DMHB 11 of the Hillingdon Local Plan: Part Two - Development Management Policies (2020), Policies D3 and HC1 of the London Plan (2021), Paragraph 202 of the National Planning Policy Framework (2021) and Section 72 of the Planning (Listed buildi

The decision to REFUSE planning permission has been taken having regard to all relevant planning legislation, regulations, guidance, circulars and Council policies, including The Human Rights Act (1998) (HRA 1998) which makes it unlawful for the Council to act incompatibly with Convention rights, specifically Article 6 (right to a fair hearing); Article 8 (right to respect for private and family life); Article 1 of the First Protocol (protection of property) and Article 14 (prohibition of discrimination).

The decision to REFUSE planning permission has been taken having regard to the policies and proposals in the Hillingdon Local Plan Part 1 (2012) and Part 2 (2020) set out below, including Supplementary Planning Guidance, and to all relevant material considerations, including The London Plan (2021) and national guidance.
